info.title: dRofus Project API
info.description:
Api by dRofus
You can find out more about Swagger at [http://swagger.io](http://swagger.io)

options.summary: Get meta information about available properties to select for current user. Use depth to include more related properties.

options.summary: Get meta information about available properties to select for current user. Use depth to include more related properties.

get.description:
Additional filter fields and supported operator: 
* default_search (`contains`)
* group_or_parent (`in`)
* classification_or_parent (`in`)


Supports lambda fielters:

* Occurrences
* Products

This allows to filter for 'where exists' a sub/related entity. Syntax is: _relatedEntityName/any(x:x/relatedEntityFilter)_.
The **relatedEntityFilter** should have a syntax as if it was searching for related entity only. 

Example: If _Occurrences_ has propety _abc_ and you want to filter where there exists any _Occurrences_ for this entity with the
property equals B you can use the following filter: `Occurrences/any(x:x/abc eq 'B')`. Note any valid filter for _Occurrences_ can be used inside the ().

get.summary: Get log entries for specified Occurrence

patch.summary: Updates an existing Occurrence with an existing status type.
patch.description:
Requires occurrence id, status type id and a payload with updating field(s).
StatusUpdate used as request/response body when updating status on requested occurrence.
When StatusUpdate is used as request payload either status code or status id is required to update status.
When StatusUpdate returned as response status code and status id verifies updated status.

requestBody.description: Can specify either status id or status code

get.summary: Gets status for given Occurrence ID and status type ID

get.description:
Additional filter fields and supported operator: 
* default_search (`contains`)
* function_or_parent (`in`)
* group (`in`)
* classification_or_parent (`in`)
* using_template (`in`)


Supports lambda fielters:

* Occurrences

This allows to filter for 'where exists' a sub/related entity. Syntax is: _relatedEntityName/any(x:x/relatedEntityFilter)_.
The **relatedEntityFilter** should have a syntax as if it was searching for related entity only. 

Example: If _Occurrences_ has propety _abc_ and you want to filter where there exists any _Occurrences_ for this entity with the
property equals B you can use the following filter: `Occurrences/any(x:x/abc eq 'B')`. Note any valid filter for _Occurrences_ can be used inside the ().

parameters.description: The ID of the Room for which to get Room Group

parameters.name: groupTypeId
parameters.description: The ID of the Room Group Type for which to get Room Group

patch.summary: Update the specified Room to use the provided Room Group under the given Room Group Type

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the Room to be updated

parameters.name: groupTypeId
parameters.description: The identifier of the Room Group Type for which to set new Room Group

requestBody.description:
Identification details of the Room Group to assign to the Room/Room Group Type. Specify either room_group_id or room_group_name.
            To un-assign the Room Group for a Room Group Type, specify the room_group_id with value 0

status_id.description: Status Id. If set, status_code is ignored

StatusUpdate.description: StatusUpdate may have status code or status id when used as request body. If none set, value is cleared

$select.name: $select
$select.description: Comma-separated list of fields to return

$orderby.name: $orderby
$orderby.description: How to sort result. Comma separated list of fields, each optionally marked with asc or desc, ie. $orderBy=id desc,name asc

$filter.name: $filter
$filter.description:
How to filter result. Ie. _name eq 'Storage'_.
            
The literal values can be strings enclosed in single quotes, numbers (with . as decimal separator) and boolean values (true or false).
            
Simple operators supported:
'eq', 'ne', 'lt', 'gt', 'le', 'ge' and 'in'
            
Functions supported:
'contains', 'notcontains', 'startswith' and 'endswith'
            
Operators 'and' and 'or' can be used to combine expressions. Use parentheses if needed to group expressions.
            
The 'in' operand MUST be a comma-separated list of primitive values enclosed in parentheses.
            
Example usage
* 'eq' - Name eq 'dRofus'
* 'in' - Address in ('Redmond', 'London')
* 'contains' - contains(CompanyName,'freds')
* 'notcontains' - notcontains(CompanyName,'freds')
* 'startswith' - startswith(Name, 'dR')
* 'endswith' - endswith(Name, 'fus')
            
Specify literal 'null' (without quotes) to search for item equal to or not equal to null.
Quotes in strings must be represented as two consecutive quotes, ie name eq 'O''Brian'
